findings.title: Semantic Consistency Checks
findings.description: Manually checking the logic of implemented smart contracts and comparing with the description in the white paper.

findings.title: Advanced DeFi Scrutiny
findings.description: Review business logics, examine system operations, and place DeFi-related aspects under scrutiny to uncover possible pitfalls and/or bugs.

findings.title: Business Logics Review
findings.description: Review of business logic implementation in smart contracts.

findings.title: Functionality Checks
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Trust Issue on Admin Keys
findings.description: In the `LuckyBid` protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account and certain privileged roles that play critical roles in governing and regulating system-wide operations.

findings.title: Access Control & Authorization
findings.description: In the `LuckyBid` protocol, there is a privileged `owner` account and certain privileged roles, i.e., `GOVERNANCE_ROLE`, `/OPERATOR/EMERGENCY_ADMIN_ROLE`, that play critical roles in governing and regulating the system-wide operations.

findings.title: Holistic Risk Management
findings.description: The audit report uses OWASP Risk Rating Methodology to evaluate the risk by assessing likelihood and impact of a vulnerability, and categorizes severity into Critical, High, Medium, and Low.

findings.title: Avoiding Use of Variadic Byte Array
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Using Fixed Compiler Version
findings.description: The audit report suggests using a fixed compiler version to ensure consistency and avoid potential issues.

findings.title: Making Visibility Level Explicit
findings.description: The audit suggests making the visibility level of functions or variables explicit to avoid potential issues.

findings.title: Making Type Inference Explicit
findings.description: The finding suggests making type inference explicit to avoid potential issues with smart contract functionality.

findings.title: Adhering To Function Declaration Strictly
findings.description: Function declarations must adhere to strict syntax and formatting rules to avoid potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Following Other Best Practices
findings.description: Additional suggestions regarding coding and development of smart contracts from the perspective of proven programming practices.

findings.title: Time and State
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to the improper management of time and state in an environment that supports simultaneous or near-simultaneous computation by multiple systems, processes, or threads.

findings.title: Error Conditions, Return Values, Status Codes
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category include weaknesses that occur if a function does not generate the correct return/status code, or if the application does not handle all possible return/status codes that could be generated by a function.

findings.title: Resource Management
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to improper management of system resources.

findings.title: Behavioral Issues
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category are related to unexpected behaviors from code that an application uses.

findings.title: Business Logics Review
findings.description: Review of business logics in smart contract implementation

findings.title: Initialization and Cleanup
findings.description: Weaknesses in this category occur in behaviors that are used for initialization and breakdown.

findings.title: Arguments and Parameters
findings.description: The functions bidWithETH() and mintWithETH() have inconsistent parameter handling.

findings.title: Expression Issues
findings.description: Potential precision loss due to incorrect order of operations in expressions.
